Function Documentation

template<class mat1 , class mat2 , class mat3 >
void ucl_cudart::ucl_cast_copy ( mat1 &  dst,
const mat2 &  src,
const size_t  rows,
const size_t  cols,
mat3 &  cast_buffer,
const bool  async 
) [inline]

Asynchronous copy subset matrix rows/cols with cast (Device/Host transfer)

Parameters:
asyncPerform non-blocking copy on default stream
cast_bufferBuffer on host with enough storage for casting
  • If src is a vector, routine assumes row-major rows by cols copy
  • If src is a matrix, routine will copy upper left tile of matrix
  • If dst is a vector, routine assumes row-major rows by cols copy
  • If dst is a matrix, routine will copy into left tile of matrix
  • If the data types for the two matrices are same, no cast performed
  • Padding for 2D matrices is not considered in this routine.
  • Copy from vector to matrix and vice versa allowed
  • Currently does not handle textures
dstThe destination buffer
srcThe source buffer
rowsThe number of rows to copy
colsThe number of columns to copy
template<class mat1 , class mat2 , class mat3 >
void ucl_cudart::ucl_cast_copy ( mat1 &  dst,
const mat2 &  src,
mat3 &  cast_buffer,
const bool  async 
) [inline]

Asynchronous copy of matrix/vector with cast (Device/Host transfer)

Parameters:
asyncPerform non-blocking copy on default stream
cast_bufferBuffer on host with enough storage for casting
  • If the data types for the two matrices are same, no cast performed
  • The number of bytes copied is determined by entire src data
  • Padding for 2D matrices is not considered in this routine.
  • Copy from vector to matrix and vice versa allowed
  • Currently does not handle textures
dstThe destination buffer
srcThe source buffer

Asynchronous copy subset matrix rows,cols with cast (Device/Host transfer)

Parameters:
cast_bufferBuffer on host with enough storage for casting
  • If src is a vector, routine assumes row-major rows by cols copy
  • If src is a matrix, routine will copy upper left tile of matrix
  • If dst is a vector, routine assumes row-major rows by cols copy
  • If dst is a matrix, routine will copy into upper left tile of matrix
  • If the data types for the two matrices are same, no cast performed
  • Padding for 2D matrices is not considered in this routine.
  • Copy from vector to matrix and vice versa allowed
  • Currently does not handle textures

cqThe command queue

template<class mat1 , class mat2 >
void ucl_cudart::ucl_copy ( mat1 &  dst,
const mat2 &  src,
const size_t  rows,
const size_t  cols,
const bool  async 
) [inline]

Copy subset of matrix rows,cols (memory already allocated)

Parameters:
asyncPerform non-blocking copy (ignored for host to host copy)
  • If src is a vector, routine assumes row-major rows by cols copy
  • If src is a matrix, routine will copy upper left tile of matrix
  • If dst is a vector, routine assumes row-major rows by cols copy
  • If dst is a matrix, routine will copy into left tile of matrix
  • If the data types of the two matrices are not the same, casting will be performed automatically as long as the copy is not device to device. For host/device transfers, a temporary buffer is created for copy. When multiple casts occur, it is more efficient to create a permanent casting buffer that can be passed to an alternative copy routine.
  • The copy should handle padding for 2D alignment correctly
  • Copy from vector to matrix and vice versa allowed
  • The default stream is used for asynchronous copy
  • Currently does not handle textures
dstThe destination buffer
srcThe source buffer
rowsThe number of rows to copy
colsThe number of columns to copy
template<class mat1 , class mat2 >
void ucl_cudart::ucl_copy ( mat1 &  dst,
const mat2 &  src,
const size_t  numel,
const bool  async 
) [inline]

Copy matrix/vector (memory already allocated)

Parameters:
numelNumber of elements (not bytes) to copy
asyncPerform non-blocking copy (ignored for host to host copy)
  • If the data types of the two matrices are not the same, casting will be performed automatically as long as the copy is not device to device. For host/device transfers, a temporary buffer is created for copy. When multiple casts occur, it is more efficient to create a permanent casting buffer that can be passed to an alternative copy routine.
  • Padding for 2D matrices is not considered in this routine.
  • The default stream is used for asynchronous copy
  • Currently does not handle textures
dstThe destination buffer
srcThe source buffer

void ucl_cudart::ucl_copy ( mat1 &  dst,
const mat2 &  src,
const bool  async 
) [inline]

Copy matrix/vector (memory already allocated)

Parameters:
asyncPerform non-blocking copy (ignored for host to host copy)
  • The number of bytes copied is determined by entire src data
  • If the data types of the two matrices are not the same, casting will be performed automatically as long as the copy is not device to device. For host/device transfers, a temporary buffer is created for copy. When multiple casts occur, it is more efficient to create a permanent casting buffer that can be passed to an alternative copy routine.
  • The copy should handle padding for 2D alignment correctly
  • Copy from vector to matrix and vice versa allowed
  • The default stream is used for asynchronous copy
  • Currently does not handle textures

template<class mat1 , class mat2 >
void ucl_cudart::ucl_copy ( mat1 &  dst,
const mat2 &  src,
command_queue &  cq 
) [inline]

Asynchronous copy of matrix/vector (memory already allocated)

  • The number of bytes copied is determined by entire src data
  • If the data types of the two matrices are not the same, casting will be performed automatically as long as the copy is not device to device. For host/device transfers, a temporary buffer is created for copy. When multiple casts occur, it is more efficient to create a permanent casting buffer that can be passed to an alternative copy routine.
  • The copy should handle padding for 2D alignment correctly
  • Copy from vector to matrix and vice versa allowed
  • Currently does not handle textures
    Parameters:
    dstThe destination buffer
    srcThe source buffer
    cqThe command queue
template<class mat1 , class mat2 >
void ucl_cudart::ucl_copy ( mat1 &  dst,
const mat2 &  src,
const size_t  rows,
const size_t  cols,
command_queue &  cq 
) [inline]

Asynchronous copy of subset matrix rows,cols (memory already allocated)

  • If src is a vector, routine assumes row-major rows by cols copy
  • If src is a matrix, routine will copy upper left tile of matrix
  • If dst is a vector, routine assumes row-major rows by cols copy
  • If dst is a matrix, routine will copy into left tile of matrix
  • If the data types of the two matrices are not the same, casting will be performed automatically as long as the copy is not device to device. For host/device transfers, a temporary buffer is created for copy. When multiple casts occur, it is more efficient to create a permanent casting buffer that can be passed to an alternative copy routine.
  • The copy should handle padding for 2D alignment correctly
  • Copy from vector to matrix and vice versa allowed
  • Currently does not handle textures
